reviewText:
As another reviewer for this game ( hollow0n3 ), I have also had problems with changing the game to windowed mode.

Does this make it a bad game though? Certainly not. From what I've played of it the combat, movement, and story are all quite solid. From the dashing mid-air, to the 'training' sword fights at the beginning, it's proved to be quite charming thus far.

It may be that I have a thing for platformers.. who knows?
I've played quite a few, and I have definitely gotten my money's worth in enjoyment so far. :)

Current score:(7/10)

I will come back and edit this review the further into the story I get.

reviewText: I never write reviews but I feel almost obligated to on this one, since it feels unfair that there is hardly any good review for the game so far. There was a couple bad bugs but the dev is working hard to fix them/has fixed them and it is an otherwise great game. Great pixel graphics, solid and rather original controls/combat, cool characters and story. Hopefully more people give it a try.

reviewText: Can't recommend this game due to the devs not having tested the game properly. It's quite open - and that is possibly it's downfall. That one guy who played it longer than me, hasn't successfully got any further than I did, so how can he recommend a game he can't complete? Seriously, it's a great looking game, the controls are odd, but you get used to them, and the story and humour is nice. If only it weren't for the fact you get stuck so early" into the game."
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Positive:

- Graphic style

- Weapon/tool selection on main character

- Story is OK, as is dialogue.

Negatives:

- Slow cards

- Map design/bugs. After following the story and picking up a key item in a room, going back to the room before it suddenly teleports you to a completely different one, when the room should be connected to a similar one. There are a few more examples like this, but this can quickly skip some content for you if you follow these maps too much. You can also get stuck on some platforms if you accidentally jump too high (which is another bug)

- Combat and movement. Hard to tell when to block enemy and you cant for example go up a ladder while jumping.. generally the movement is just too jumpy.. its like you are controlling leaping frogs from that board game

- Some of the music is too tingly

- Lack of checkpoints when there are some bugs or areas coming up that you can't really be sure of how dangerous they are. for example, there might be a empty chasm in front of you and you try jumping down from it thinking there is another room, but you die instead and have to restart from last save (which can be pretty far and even behind extra dialogue).

- Some of the setting/rooms not being very fitting

- Lack of coin drops from enemies and other things and only being able to get a few coins at a time from things like bosses and breakable objects. Because of this you won't even have much money for upgrades and might have to grind (I'm not sure, because I'm gonna stop playing after getting cards).

- Prestige" achievements

6/10 but I still recommend giving it a try as I think others might like it."
voteText: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I don't usually play platformers and as i got a coupon for this game, I thought I'd play for a couple hours to get the cards, then forget about it.

..... 8 hours later i was still playing it

Oh, yes, it has still a few bugs, but the playability more than makes up for it as well as the... well.. not much as a story at the beginning, but it's a bit hylarious that all those disadventures started just because your friend wanted a few berries from just outside the town....

And up towers to fall down precipices and in caves, towns, forests, ancient libraries, etc etc while at the same time discovering quite a bit of the backstory of the main character ;D

(and BTW the grappling hook isn't stolen if the owner is your friend and not only allows you to borrow it, but also tells you where it is :) )

reviewText:
ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW THE DIVIDE:

I gave this a negative review first because bugs made the game near to fully unplayble at first.
I promised to wait a week for the dev to bring out fixes and look at it again then.
I just did that, here's what I conclude from that.

It seems the window/fullscreen bug that got the displayed area of the game limited to one corner of the actual screen it should show got fixed.
Same for the lockup of keyboard and controller input that made me stop attempting to play previously.

This is a plattforrmer game with a story, you are a wind type fighter but you wont notice that much at first since you work in the library.
The control scheme is seemingly oldschool and awkward at the same time.
You press up to jump by default which makes jump dashing somewhat tricky, especially when using a joypad.
More about the controlls and the problems I found with them below..

If you explore a lot between story bits like me there is a chance that you will run into the first monster while having no way to defend yourself beside running.

Some messages that are supposed to give tutorial hints vanish  too fast to be of much use.
Graphics are okay for this type of plattformer, but have some weaknesses which are appearent while changing rooms/maps. The scrolling isnt as smooth as it could be especially when you are in a smaller room, which usally results in the map moving a noticeable bit before the room/map actually changes.

Controlling your character can be harder then it needs to be, since my xbox controller somehow uses all keys from all control shemes in the options at the same time.
As in, once I got a certain item that was supposed to make it easier to reach places previously not possible it did that, but at the same time brought the pause menu up.
Which.. made it a lot harder. Changing the controlls in the menu did have an effect, sadly still overlayed all controll shemes. The control display GUI in the upper right corner of the screen also reflects that after I kept an eye on it, it keeps changing back and forth between keyboard and controller button lables.

I assume this will be fixed later on, if I could give this a neutral review I would. Unfortunally steam does not have that option. I played plattformer games since the original gianna sisters was new.
I still play lots of them. This has some potential but awkward default controls make it hard to enjoy unless one is into that extra challenge caused by that.

Graphics, solid for what the game tries to be, music and sound effects? Similar.
Fun, maybe for you, not so much for me. I stopped a bit after I got the third Item which caused me to notice the problem with current controls.

So, did I actually try this? Now that I could, I did for as far as I could stand right now.
Which isnt that much because of the problem with control shemes overlaping.
This tries to be a plattformer with story and metroidvania elements, it falls short for me personally.
So, I repeat, neutral review, this got good and bad parts. Decide for yourself.


~~~ THIS IS THE DIVIDE ~~~


Within the first attempts to play this I encountered a bug that makes it impossible to properly set the graphic settings to window mode the first time.
Then a bug that makes ALL controls unresponsive when loading a saved game.

In the current state this is not something anyone should attempt to play.
*If* it gets fixed while I still have this installed I'll try again and maybe change my review.

EDIT: The dev posted in my related thread that he will look into the bugs and hammer away at them.
I'll leave the game installed for a week and check again then, it's also nice how many downvotes I get for mentioning problems the dev and other people recognise as real.
